intro: Leiotulus secacul subsp. secacul, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It typically features succulent, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in dry environments. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the cooler months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it well-adapted to survive in harsh, drought-prone conditions.
